commit_list.message: doc: Merge/update old Object.inspect doc into source [#118 state:fixed_in_branch]

Add support for user_properties when sending events

Amplitude's API supports arbitrary user_properties on their event HTTP API (https://amplitude.zendesk.com/hc/en-us/articles/204771828-HTTP-API)
commit_list.repo_description: A Ruby library for interacting with the Amplitude API

commit_list.message: Green suite locally!
Little bit o' cleanup
Bump gems to latest
More data tweaking. Also data presentation tweaking.
remove unused dep
lots of random minor changes. mostly cleaning up (or trying to) the UI for editing assignments on a user's staffplan
Fix up calculation, rendering and up-to-datedness of user's totals for actual/estimated.
Upcoming estimated hours should include *all* upcoming hours, not just ones in the range.
Fix sorting of users by workload/name on the staffplans page
Update all assets from bower because we can.
Rename components to more closely align with the view names that drive them
Fix immediate issues with staffplan view page. Lots of little things remain.
Naming is hard. Rename the staffplans/assignments views. Hopefully the last time.
Refactor the work week select criteria to be indifferent toward daylight savings time.
Add newrelic server monitoring.
FIx JS issue with staffplan-redux.herokuapp.com.
temporarily disable after_update here
Random checkpoint. Started re-working the database views and controller/UI code to suit.
Much better.
Finally progress re: async page data loading. Need to fix quite a bit — next/previous come to mind. Getting there.
Add an .envrc, binstubs and the spring gem
Add a UserDecorator
did 4.1.8 cause this?

Merge pull request #45 from rescuedcode/staffplan_functionality

First-pass implementation at staffplan functionality
mark controller specs as pending. bump to 2.1.4

Break apart staffplan index/show aggregate charts into separate components.
  * TODO: DRY up visible work week calculation
  * TODO: review code for perf issues and/or dead functions/parameters
Design review notes.

Getting close. Need to fix the issue of new values being cleared from inputs (directly related to the wonky data model passing back and forth I'm doing) Going to look at using ko.mapping to improve the code clarity/sanity.
Fix re-draw of work weeks on screen resize.
Clean up data propagation, add all company users for the reassignment select element
Implement rudimentary assignment re-assignment.
Implement UI portion of assignment archive/propose toggling. Also deleting. Server-side doesn't receive updates, yet.
Implement client-side toggling of archived/active only assignments on the staffplan.
Not sure how this typo slipped by me a dozen times. Copy pasta!
Missed a few things. Need to set the ID if we're creating a work week in the database. Fix up callback args.
Implement work week create/update from the interface. Cleaned up some unused .rb files.
Indent
Re-applying some field renaming from another branch. Don't ask.
style fixes
Fix rendering issues for work weeks with data.
Bump ruby/rails versions
Add href attributes so browsers show the pointer mouse icon.
Simplifying CSS a bit. I suspect we'll do something different than a fixed header here, maybe a fancy growing/shrinking one as the page is scrolled.

  - refactored the knockout more, trying to simplify code/events and make naming consistent and sensical
  - first pass at a staffplan where users can add clients and assignments!
  - next step, work weeks.

First pass at better performance for the site in general. Try loading data after the page has loaded JS/CSS. Also, I shrunk the size of the payload by ~66% while preserving all of the data transferred.

Squashed commit of the following:

commit 3e980f34143226b6c06e85bed1c3ad66b7b41160
Author: Rob Sterner <rob.sterner@gmail.com>
Date:   Sun Dec 1 21:39:13 2013 -0500

    First pass at improving application performance. Load the data *after* initially rendering the site.

commit 1805d3405e3df125ddcd3a7ca7f2b353109de1e4
Author: Rob Sterner <rob.sterner@gmail.com>
Date:   Sun Dec 1 21:37:24 2013 -0500

    Bump version of lodash, add string.js and async.js.

commit ac1b94430009782c5f45e278752bb524bef182bf
Author: Rob Sterner <rob.sterner@gmail.com>
Date:   Sun Dec 1 21:35:58 2013 -0500

    Try using unicorn in production. Might help with page load times by handling multiple concurrent requests.

Author: Rob Sterner <rob.sterner@gmail.com>
